tool.name: ApplyFilterbyObj
tool.displayname: Apply Filters to Collection Dataset by Serialized Object

param.name: ee_obj
param.displayname: Select the JSON file of the serialized object
param.dialogReference: The serialized Google Earth Engine object in JSON format. Browse and select the target JSON file to load.

param.name: filter_list
param.dialogReference: Select filters and apply arguments. For example, to filter by date, choose filter ee.Filter.date and apply argument in this format '2015-01-01', '2018-01-01'. Another example, to filter by equal, choose filter ee.Filter.eq and apply argument in this format 'CLOUD_COVER', 0. You can apply as many filters as needed.

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Specify the output JSON file to save the string format of the filtered dataset
param.dialogReference: Save the filtered dataset as a serialized JSON object for future use. When you use this JSON file again, the dataset will already have the filters applied.

tool.summary:
This script applies filters to feature collection or image collection by serialized JSON object, and saves the filtered dataset to a new serialized JSON object for future use. It is useful when you want to apply filters to the existing JSON object.

To browser all available earth engine filters, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-filter.

For a quick guide on filtering feature collection, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/feature_collection_filtering.

For a quick guide on filtering image collection, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/ic_filtering

idCitation.resTitle: Apply Filters to Collection Dataset by Serialized Object
